Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a slave holding an amphora. The wide rounded shoulder is decorated with plant tendrils in relief. On top of the nozzle is an indistinct mask. At the rear is an applied handle (broken); on each side is an ornamental lug. Within the pseudo-base-ring are traces of an impressed inscription.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2080)
